title: Angela Merkel - Wikipedia
snippet: Angela Dorothea Merkel (German pronunciation: [aŋˈɡeːla doʁoˈteːa ˈmɛʁkl̩] ⓘ; née Kasner; born 17 July 1954) is a German retired politician who served as Chancellor of Germany from 2005 to 2021. She is the only woman to have held the office and the only from former East Germany.

title: Angela Merkel | Book, Biography, Putin, Education, Freedom, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: As a result, more than one million ... Hamburg, West Germany) is a German politician who served as chancellor of Germany from 2005 to 2021....

title: Full article: Angela Merkel’s Last Term – An Introduction
snippet: On 8 December 2021, Angela Merkel’s tenure as Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany ended – after 4 terms and 5,860 days in office. She missed Helmut Kohl’s incumbency record by only ten days, thus becoming the second-longest serving ...

title: Chart: End of the Merkel Era | Statista
snippet: The 67-year-old is no longer the German conservative party’s candidate to head a new government after the September 26 elections, the usual procedure for a chancellor completing a fourth term.

title: Germany sets general election date and an end to the Merkel era | Euronews
snippet: The date of the next election is set for 26 September 2021, and Merkel is adamant that she won't be seeking a fifth term. This will be the country's twentieth post-World War II parliamentary election.
